data.title: Syracuse University Athletics
data.meta_description: Marcus Sales (5) Wide Receiver - At SU: Four letters … His 16 career touchdown receptions ties with Scott Schwedes for sixth on SU’s career record list … One...
data.text:
At SU: Four letters … His 16 career touchdown receptions ties with Scott Schwedes for sixth on SU’s career record list … One of eight true freshmen to play in 2008.

Redshirt Senior (2012): Played in all 13 games, started in 12 of the 13 games...Averaged 67.8 receiving yards per game, which ranked fourth in the BIG EAST … His 4.9 receptions per game ranked third in the BIG EAST …Tied for the league lead in 100-yard receiving performances (5) … Played in all 13 games, including 12 starts ... Against Northwestern, had a career-high 12 receptions for 129 yards and one touchdown ... Against USC, had eight catches for 104 yards and two touchdowns ... Against Stony Brook, recorded his fourth consecutive game with at least 100 receiving yards, tallying five catches for 117 yards and one touchdown ... At Minnesota, Sales extended his streak to eight consecutive games with a catch, recording two receptions for 32 yards and one touchdown ... Had his fifth straight game a touchdown reception against the Golden Gophers, which ties him with Marvin Harris, Rob Moore, and Tommy Kane for the second-longest streak in team history ... Against Pittsburgh, had six catches for 63 yards, totalling 101 receptions for his career, making him tenth on SU’s all-time list ... At Rutgers, caught four passes for 100 yards ... At USF, had nine catches for 125 yards and two touchdowns, earning the ECAC co-Offensive Player of the Week and a spot on the BIG EAST Weekly Honor Roll ... At Cincinnati, caught four passes for 52 yards ... Against Louisville, caught two passes for ten yards ... At Missouri, caught eight passes for 85 yards ... At Temple, caught three passes for 46 yards and one touchdown ... Against West Virginia in the New Era Pinstripe Bowl, he caught one pass for 19 yards.

Senior Year (2011): Did not play in any games.

Junior Year (2010): Played in 11 games, including three starts .... At South Florida, scored the game winning touchdown on a three-yard catch … The reception was his first of the season and his fifth career touchdown .... Against Pittsburgh, had four receptions for 36 yards ... At Rutgers, had five catches for 73 yards, including two receptions for 20 yards during SU's game-winning drive in the fourth quarter ... Against Connecticut, had a season-best six receptions for 57 yards ... Against Boston College, had five catches for 72 yards ... Against Kansas State in the Pinstripe Bowl, had five receptions for 172 yards and three touchdowns.

Sophomore Year (2009): Played in all 12 games, including five starts … At Penn State, had one catch for 12 yards … Against Maine, had a 17-yard reception for a touchdown … Against South Florida, had two catches for 22 yards… Against West Virginia, had two receptions for 30 yards, including a touchdown… Against Akron, had six receptions for 61 yards, including a touchdown… Against Cincinnati, had two receptions for 13 yards … At Pittsburgh, had four receptions for 36 yards … Against Rutgers, had three catches for 44 yards … At Connecticut, had seven catches for 89 yards.

Freshman Year (2008): Played in 11 games … At Northwestern, recorded first career reception on an eight-yard pass … Against Penn State, had an 11-yard touchdown catch … Against Northeastern, posted 41 receiving yards on two receptions, including a game-long 25-yard catch … Against Pittsburgh, had one reception for six yards … At West Virginia, caught three passes for 20 yards … At South Florida, had a 28-yard reception … Against Louisville, had one catch for 12 yards … At Notre Dame, caught two passes for 18 yards … At Cincinnati, had two receptions for 16 yards.

High School: 2007 SuperPrep and PrepStar All-American … Rated 43rd-best wide receiver in the nation and second-best New York prospect by Rivals.com … Listed as the 29th-best wide receiver in the country by Scout.com … Played for New York in the 2008 NIKE NY-NJ All Star Classic … Named to 2007 Football NYSSWA All-State Class AA First Team Offense after recording 39 catches for 700 yards and five touchdowns … Selected first-team all-league … Team captain as a senior … As a junior, caught 33 passes for 600 yards and seven touchdowns … High School Coach: Joe Casamento … Attended same high school as current SU center Macky MacPherson and offensive tackle Andrew Phillips.

Personal: Marcus Dashawn Sales … Born in October 1989 in Syracuse, N.Y. … Son of Rose and Mike Sales … Two brothers … Majoring in child and family studies

Sales's Career Statistics
